title: Arbor Health surgeon receives Excellence in Healthcare Award | The Daily Chronicle
text: Arbor Health foot and ankle surgeon G. Parker Peresko was recently recognized as a top performing doctor for his performance in providing quality care, according to a news release from Arbor Health. The award was presented by Professional Research Consultants (PRC), a leader in the health care intelligence space. PRC is a nationally-recognized organization that supports over 2,800 health care organizations across all 50 states. The Excellence in Healthcare Awards recognize organizations and individuals who achieve excellence throughout the year by improving patient experiences, health care employee engagement and physician alignment and engagement based on surveys of their patients, according to the news release. Peresko’s award was determined by his patients’ ratings for the care he provided. “It is an honor to recognize G. Parker Peresko and Arbor Health — Morton Clinic with this Excellence in Healthcare Award for their deserving work,” said Dr. Joe M. Inguanzo, president and CEO of PRC. “It takes true dedication and determination to achieve this level of excellence in health care, and Dr. Peresko and Arbor Health have shown their commitment to making their health care facilities a better place to work, a better place to practice medicine and a better place for patients to be treated.” Arbor Health CEO Robert Mach said he was delighted to see Peresko earn the award. “This recognition is a testament to Dr. Peresko's unwavering dedication, exceptional clinical expertise and commitment to delivering outstanding patient care,” Mach said in the release. “Through his tireless efforts, Dr. Peresko has consistently demonstrated a profound understanding of medical excellence and a passion for improving healthcare outcomes. His relentless pursuit of quality has not only impacted individual patients positively but has also set a benchmark for excellence within our medical community. Dr. Peresko's remarkable achievements serve as an inspiration to his colleagues and a source of pride for the entire Arbor Health organization. We are truly fortunate to have such a remarkable physician among us, and this award is a well-deserved acknowledgment of his invaluable contributions to the field of medicine and our community.” Lewis County Hospital District No. 1 is the parent organization of Arbor Health, the East Lewis County-based health system. The organization includes Morton Hospital, the Rapid Care Clinic and the specialty clinic in Morton as well as the Morton, Mossyrock, Randle and Packwood primary care clinics.
